intro: Euphrasia heslop-harrisonii, commonly known as the Heslop-Harrison's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers with prominent dark markings. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. This species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to high-altitude habitats.
